actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 102-356.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 213.
Mr. Sikorski moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 616.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Sikorski asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendments.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Message on House action received in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-487.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: Amend the title so as to read: An Act to amend chapter 45 of title 5, United States Code, to authorize awards for cost saving disclosures.

summary.text: Makes permanent current provisions of Federal law concerning agency awards and presidential awards for cost savings disclosures.

titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, with respect to certain programs under which awards may be made to Federal employees for superior accomplishments or cost savings disclosures, and for other purposes.
Amend the title so as to read: An Act to amend chapter 45 of title 5, United States Code, to authorize awards for cost saving disclosures.
